home.intro_1: Comprehensive assessment of hazardous effects caused by impacts of cosmic bodies
home.intro_3: Estimation of air-blast and radiation effects, crater and ejecta, seismic effect and atmospheric disturbances
home.intro_4: asteroids and comets: diameter from 15 m to 3 km; velocity from 10 to 72 km/s
home.intro_5: Calculator applies the scaling relations based on the serial numerical simulation results of large number of different scenarios

density.label: Density
density.help: Density of cosmic body (kg/m<sup>3</sup>). It is assumed that asteroid density is in the range 2000-3320 kg/m<sup>3</sup>, cometary objects density is 500-1200 kg/m<sup>3</sup>

velocity.label: Velocity
velocity.help: Projectile entry velocity is in the range from 12 to 72 km/s

entry angle.label: Entry angle
entry angle.help: The projectile entry angle (i.e., the angle to the Earth's surface). Setting it to 90¬∞ means that the projectile falls vertically.

target type.label: Target Type
target type.help:
The target type determines the properties of the surface on which the cosmic body hits.
Density of a rock is 2650, sand: 1600 kg/m3

zero point.label: Zero Point
zero point.entry point 100km: Entry point at 100km above the ground
zero point.surface intersection: The point of intersection of the trajectory with the Earth's surface

entry vector.help:
The latitude and the longitude of the projectile entry point.
Both latitude and longitude are measured in degrees. Latitude ranges from -90¬∞ to 90¬∞. Longitude ranges from -180¬∞ to 180¬∞.

along across.label: along-across
along across.along help: L<sub>y</sub> The distance along the trajectory from the zero point to the point of intersection with the perpendicular drawn from the observation point to the projection of the trajectory
along across.across help: L<sub>x</sub> The length of the perpendicular drawn from the observation point to the projection of the trajectory of the cosmic body

distance angle.label: distance-angle
distance angle.distance help title: Distance to the Zero Point, L
distance angle.distance help: The distance between the point of effect and the zero point (L)
distance angle.angle help: The angle between the direction from the observation point to the zero point and the projection of the trajectory on the surface of the Earth (ùúì)

latitude longitude.label: latitude-longitude
latitude longitude.distance help title: Distance to the Zero Point, L
latitude longitude.distance help: The distance between the point of effect and the zero point (L)
latitude longitude.angle help: The angle between the direction from the observation point to the zero point and the projection of the trajectory on the surface of the Earth (ùúì)

shockwave.description:
Numerical simulations of a shock wave from the cosmic object impact provide possibility to suggest scaling
relations for a value of maximal overpressure and its distribution on the surface, for maximal wind velocity
behind the front and for a squares, where overpressure is larger than a fixed levelall values are determined
based only on the properties of the impactor
shockwave.Distance to the center: Distance to the center of a overpressure field from the point of intersection of the trajectory with the Earth`s surface
shockwave.Areas: Areas, at which chosen levels of overpressure exceed
shockwave.The value of the overpressure: The value of the overpressure in the point of observation
shockwave.Maximum wind speed: Maximum wind speed behind the shock front in the point of observation

irradiation.description: One of the main hazardous effects of the cosmic body impacts
irradiation.Distance to the center: Distance to the center of a radiation field from the point of intersection of the trajectory with the Earth`s surface
irradiation.Thermal exposure in the point of observa: Thermal exposure in the point of observation
irradiation.Thermal flux in the point of observation: Thermal flux in the point of observation

schema.Entry point: Entry point at 100km above the ground
schema.Entry direction: Direction from entry point at 100km above the ground
schema.Surface intersection point: The point of intersection of the trajectory with the Earth's surface
schema.Effective thermal point source: Position of effective thermal point source
schema.Effective overpressure point source: Position of effective overpressure point source
